items.name: typealias Float16.Exponent
items.desc: A type that can represent any written exponent.

items.name: typealias Float16.FloatLiteralType
items.desc: A type that represents a floating-point literal.

items.name: typealias Float16.IntegerLiteralType
items.desc: A type that represents an integer literal.

items.name: typealias Float16.Magnitude
items.desc: A type that can represent the absolute value of any possible value of the conforming type.

items.name: typealias Float16.RawExponent
items.desc: A type that represents the encoded exponent of a value.

items.name: typealias Float16.RawSignificand
items.desc: A type that represents the encoded significand of a value.

items.name: typealias Float16.Stride
items.desc: A type that represents the distance between two values.

items.name: init<Source>(Source)
items.desc: Creates a new instance from the given value, rounded to the closest possible representation.

items.name: init<Source>(Source)
items.desc: Creates a new value, rounded to the closest possible representation.

items.name: init(Float16)
items.desc: Creates a new instance initialized to the given value.

items.name: init(Double)
items.desc: Creates a new instance that approximates the given value.

items.name: init(Float)
items.desc: Creates a new instance that approximates the given value.

items.name: init?<S>(S)
items.desc: Creates a new instance from the given string.

items.name: init(Int)
items.desc: Creates a new value, rounded to the closest possible representation.

items.name: init<Source>(Source)
items.desc: Creates a new value, rounded to the closest possible representation.

items.name: init(bitPattern: UInt16)
items.desc: Creates a new value with the given bit pattern.

items.name: init?<Source>(exactly: Source)
items.desc: Creates a new instance from the given value, if it can be represented exactly.

items.name: init?<Source>(exactly: Source)
items.desc: Creates a new value, if the given integer can be represented exactly.

items.name: init?(exactly: Float16)
items.desc: Creates a new instance initialized to the given value, if it can be represented without rounding.

items.name: init?(exactly: Double)
items.desc: Creates a new instance initialized to the given value, if it can be represented without rounding.

items.name: init?(exactly: Float)
items.desc: Creates a new instance initialized to the given value, if it can be represented without rounding.

items.name: init?<Source>(exactly: Source)
items.desc: Creates a new value, if the given integer can be represented exactly.

items.name: init(floatLiteral: Float16)
items.desc: Creates an instance initialized to the specified floating-point value.

items.name: init(from: Decoder)
items.desc: Creates a new instance by decoding from the given decoder.

items.name: init(integerLiteral: Float16)
items.desc: Creates an instance initialized to the specified integer value.

items.name: init(integerLiteral: Int64)
items.desc: Creates an instance initialized to the specified integer value.

items.name: init(nan: Float16.RawSignificand, signaling: Bool)
items.desc: Creates a NaN (“not a number”) value with the specified payload.

items.name: init(sign: FloatingPointSign, exponent: Int, significand: Float16)
items.desc: Creates a new value from the given sign, exponent, and significand.

items.name: init(sign: FloatingPointSign, exponentBitPattern: UInt, significandBitPattern: UInt16)
items.desc: Creates a new instance from the specified sign and bit patterns.

items.name: init(signOf: Float16, magnitudeOf: Float16)
items.desc: Creates a new floating-point value using the sign of one value and the magnitude of another.

items.name: var binade: Float16
items.desc: The floating-point value with the same sign and exponent as this value, but with a significand of 1.0.

items.name: var bitPattern: UInt16
items.desc: The bit pattern of the value’s encoding.

items.name: var debugDescription: String
items.desc: A textual representation of the value, suitable for debugging.

items.name: var description: String
items.desc: A textual representation of the value.

items.name: var exponent: Int
items.desc: The exponent of the floating-point value.

items.name: var exponentBitPattern: UInt
items.desc: The raw encoding of the value’s exponent field.

items.name: var floatingPointClass: FloatingPointClassification
items.desc: The classification of this value.

items.name: var hashValue: Int
items.desc: The hash value.

items.name: var isCanonical: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value indicating whether the instance’s representation is in its canonical form.

items.name: var isFinite: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value indicating whether this instance is finite.

items.name: var isInfinite: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value indicating whether the instance is infinite.

items.name: var isNaN: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value indicating whether the instance is NaN (“not a number”).

items.name: var isNormal: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value indicating whether this instance is normal.

items.name: var isSignalingNaN: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value indicating whether the instance is a signaling NaN.

items.name: var isSubnormal: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value indicating whether the instance is subnormal.

items.name: var isZero: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value indicating whether the instance is equal to zero.

items.name: var magnitude: Float16
items.desc: The magnitude of this value.

items.name: var nextDown: Float16
items.desc: The greatest representable value that compares less than this value.

items.name: var nextUp: Float16
items.desc: The least representable value that compares greater than this value.

items.name: var sign: FloatingPointSign
items.desc: The sign of the floating-point value.

items.name: var significand: Float16
items.desc: The significand of the floating-point value.

items.name: var significandBitPattern: UInt16
items.desc: The raw encoding of the value’s significand field.

items.name: var significandWidth: Int
items.desc: The number of bits required to represent the value’s significand.

items.name: var ulp: Float16
items.desc: The unit in the last place of this value.

items.name: static var exponentBitCount: Int
items.desc: The number of bits used to represent the type’s exponent.

items.name: static var greatestFiniteMagnitude: Float16
items.desc: The greatest finite number representable by this type.

items.name: static var infinity: Float16
items.desc: Positive infinity.

items.name: static var leastNonzeroMagnitude: Float16
items.desc: The least positive number.

items.name: static var leastNormalMagnitude: Float16
items.desc: The least positive normal number.

items.name: static var nan: Float16
items.desc: A quiet NaN (“not a number”).

items.name: static var pi: Float16
items.desc: The mathematical constant pi.

items.name: static var radix: Int
items.desc: The radix, or base of exponentiation, for a floating-point type.

items.name: static var signalingNaN: Float16
items.desc: A signaling NaN (“not a number”).

items.name: static var significandBitCount: Int
items.desc: The available number of fractional significand bits.

items.name: static var ulpOfOne: Float16
items.desc: The unit in the last place of 1.0.

items.name: static var zero: Float16
items.desc: The zero value.

items.name: func addProduct(Float16, Float16)
items.desc: Adds the product of the two given values to this value in place, computed without intermediate rounding.

items.name: func addingProduct(Float16, Float16) -> Float16
items.desc: Returns the result of adding the product of the two given values to this value, computed without intermediate rounding.

items.name: func advanced(by: Float16) -> Float16
items.desc: Returns a value that is offset the specified distance from this value.

items.name: func distance(to: Float16) -> Float16
items.desc: Returns the distance from this value to the given value, expressed as a stride.

items.name: func encode(to: Encoder)
items.desc: Encodes this value into the given encoder.

items.name: func formRemainder(dividingBy: Float16)
items.desc: Replaces this value with the remainder of itself divided by the given value.

items.name: func formSquareRoot()
items.desc: Replaces this value with its square root, rounded to a representable value.

items.name: func formTruncatingRemainder(dividingBy: Float16)
items.desc: Replaces this value with the remainder of itself divided by the given value using truncating division.

items.name: func hash(into: inout Hasher)
items.desc: Hashes the essential components of this value by feeding them into the given hasher.

items.name: func isEqual(to: Float16) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether this instance is equal to the given value.

items.name: func isLess(than: Float16) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether this instance is less than the given value.

items.name: func isLessThanOrEqualTo(Float16) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether this instance is less than or equal to the given value.

items.name: func isTotallyOrdered(belowOrEqualTo: Float16) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether this instance should precede or tie positions with the given value in an ascending sort.

items.name: func negate()
items.desc: Replaces this value with its additive inverse.

items.name: func remainder(dividingBy: Float16) -> Float16
items.desc: Returns the remainder of this value divided by the given value.

items.name: func round(FloatingPointRoundingRule)
items.desc: Rounds the value to an integral value using the specified rounding rule.

items.name: func rounded(FloatingPointRoundingRule) -> Float16
items.desc: Returns this value rounded to an integral value using the specified rounding rule.

items.name: func squareRoot() -> Float16
items.desc: Returns the square root of the value, rounded to a representable value.

items.name: func truncatingRemainder(dividingBy: Float16) -> Float16
items.desc: Returns the remainder of this value divided by the given value using truncating division.

items.name: func write<Target>(to: inout Target)
items.desc: Writes a textual representation of this instance into the given output stream.

items.name: static func maximum(Float16, Float16) -> Float16
items.desc: Returns the greater of the two given values.

items.name: static func maximumMagnitude(Float16, Float16) -> Float16
items.desc: Returns the value with greater magnitude.

items.name: static func minimum(Float16, Float16) -> Float16
items.desc: Returns the lesser of the two given values.

items.name: static func minimumMagnitude(Float16, Float16) -> Float16
items.desc: Returns the value with lesser magnitude.

items.name: static func random(in: ClosedRange<Float16>) -> Float16
items.desc: Returns a random value within the specified range.

items.name: static func random(in: Range<Float16>) -> Float16
items.desc: Returns a random value within the specified range.

items.name: static func random<T>(in: ClosedRange<Float16>, using: inout T) -> Float16
items.desc: Returns a random value within the specified range, using the given generator as a source for randomness.

items.name: static func random<T>(in: Range<Float16>, using: inout T) -> Float16
items.desc: Returns a random value within the specified range, using the given generator as a source for randomness.

items.name: static func * (Float16, Float16) -> Float16
items.desc: Multiplies two values and produces their product, rounding to a representable value.

items.name: static func *= (inout Float16, Float16)
items.desc: Multiplies two values and stores the result in the left-hand-side variable, rounding to a representable value.

items.name: static func + (Float16) -> Float16
items.desc: Returns the given number unchanged.

items.name: static func + (Float16, Float16) -> Float16
items.desc: Adds two values and produces their sum, rounded to a representable value.

items.name: static func += (inout Float16, Float16)
items.desc: Adds two values and stores the result in the left-hand-side variable, rounded to a representable value.

items.name: static func - (Float16) -> Float16
items.desc: Calculates the additive inverse of a value.

items.name: static func - (Float16, Float16) -> Float16
items.desc: Subtracts one value from another and produces their difference, rounded to a representable value.

items.name: static func -= (inout Float16, Float16)
items.desc: Subtracts the second value from the first and stores the difference in the left-hand-side variable, rounding to a representable value.

items.name: static func ... (Float16) -> PartialRangeFrom<Float16>
items.desc: Returns a partial range extending upward from a lower bound.

items.name: static func ... (Float16) -> PartialRangeThrough<Float16>
items.desc: Returns a partial range up to, and including, its upper bound.

items.name: static func ... (Float16, Float16) -> ClosedRange<Float16>
items.desc: Returns a closed range that contains both of its bounds.

items.name: static func ..< (Float16) -> PartialRangeUpTo<Float16>
items.desc: Returns a partial range up to, but not including, its upper bound.

items.name: static func ..< (Float16, Float16) -> Range<Float16>
items.desc: Returns a half-open range that contains its lower bound but not its upper bound.

items.name: static func / (Float16, Float16) -> Float16
items.desc: Returns the quotient of dividing the first value by the second, rounded to a representable value.

items.name: static func /= (inout Float16, Float16)
items.desc: Divides the first value by the second and stores the quotient in the left-hand-side variable, rounding to a representable value.

items.name: static func < (Float16, Float16) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is less than that of the second argument.

items.name: static func <= (Float16, Float16) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is less than or equal to that of the second argument.

items.name: static func == (Float16, Float16) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether two values are equal.

items.name: static func > (Float16, Float16) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is greater than that of the second argument.

items.name: static func >= (Float16, Float16) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is greater than or equal to that of the second argument.

items.name: struct Float16.SIMD16Storage
items.desc: Storage for a vector of 16 floating-point values.

items.name: struct Float16.SIMD2Storage
items.desc: Storage for a vector of two floating-point values.

items.name: struct Float16.SIMD32Storage
items.desc: Storage for a vector of 32 floating-point values.

items.name: struct Float16.SIMD4Storage
items.desc: Storage for a vector of four floating-point values.

items.name: struct Float16.SIMD64Storage
items.desc: Storage for a vector of 64 floating-point values.

items.name: struct Float16.SIMD8Storage
items.desc: Storage for a vector of eight floating-point values.
